questions.text: The Cold War was primarily between which two superpowers?
questions.explanation: The Cold War was a period of geopolitical tension between the United States and the Soviet Union.

questions.text: In which year did man first walk on the moon?
questions.explanation: Apollo 11 landed on the moon on July 20, 1969.

questions.text: Who was the British Prime Minister during most of World War II?
questions.explanation: Churchill led Britain to victory in the Second World War.

questions.text: The Chernobyl nuclear disaster occurred in which year?
questions.explanation: The catastrophe occurred on April 26, 1986, in the Ukrainian SSR.

questions.text: Which wall divided Berlin from 1961 to 1989?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall physically and ideologically divided Berlin.

questions.text: Who was the first female Prime Minister of the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: Margaret Thatcher served from 1979 to 1990 and was known as the 'Iron Lady'.

questions.text: The attack on the World Trade Center occurred on:
questions.explanation: The 9/11 attacks were a series of airline hijackings by al-Qaeda.

questions.text: Which treaty created the European Union in 1993?
questions.explanation: The Maastricht Treaty established the European Union.

questions.text: Who was the leader of the Civil Rights Movement in the US known for his 'I Have a Dream' speech?
questions.explanation: MLK Jr. delivered the iconic speech during the March on Washington in 1963.

questions.text: The internet (ARPANET) sent its first message in which decade?
questions.explanation: The first message 'LO' (intended to be LOGIN) was sent on October 29, 1969.

questions.text: Which virus caused a global pandemic starting in 1918?
questions.explanation: The 1918 influenza pandemic infected 500 million people worldwide.

questions.text: Nelson Mandela became the first black president of South Africa in:
questions.explanation: Mandela was elected in the first fully representative democratic election.

questions.text: The Euro currency was introduced in physical form in:
questions.explanation: Euro banknotes and coins entered circulation on January 1, 2002.

questions.text: Who was the US President during the Cuban Missile Crisis?
questions.explanation: JFK navigated the crisis in October 1962.
The RMS Titanic hit an iceberg and sank on April 15, 1912.
